> The second question is perhaps more of a comment than a question. I
> thi=
nk that when a novice asks us a question, it's OK for us to
> provide a sim=
ple, dogmatic-sounding answer. This person is learning,
> and is therefore =
not well-informed about the consequences of the
> choices he has in front o=
f him.

Also known as Shu or Level 1 audience: http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?ShuHa=
Ri
http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?ThreeLevelsOfAudience

> That said, perhaps we
> =
ought to ask more questions before giving answers....

That's certainly a h=
euristic I like. It's sometimes a little bit frustrating
to apply though, b=
ecause people typically  reply more positively to
solutions than to more qu=
estions. The solutions don't even have to be very
adequate... <sigh>
